@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q5: the vaccination maximizes our protection from severe disease and hospitalization. The infection though is still possible, especially with a much more infective and transmissible Delta variant.

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q5: We are not over panicking. While the vaccination proceeds, there are still people around us who cannot be vaccinated or have not yet been covered in the national vaccine rollout.

By vaccinating ourselves we protect them and ourselves.

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q4: As the composite score does include test positivity, this does take into account the testing rate at least to an extent. The inclusion of testing data in the model projections depends on each model included in the ensemble forecasts. More info here:  https://t.co/DL4hckJ7gi

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q4: The composite score contains testing data (test positivity), which is provided to ECDC by the Member States, and which includes both PCR & antigen tests (but there might be variations in the data that the countries are able to include and report).
@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q3: The composite score method is best described in the Annex 2 of the 15th update of ECDC‚Äôs Risk Assessment for COVID-19: https://t.co/LsYogF5rI9

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q2: No, to date the composite score is only used in the surveillance reports & risk assessments. Maps in support of the Council Recommendation are based on data on incidence of cases, testing rate & test positivity only.

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q1: The final score between 1 and 10 is split evenly into quintiles to produce the categories used. A higher score indicates an epidemiological situation of greater concern. The method is described in Annex 2 of the 15th update of ECDC‚Äôs RRA: https://t.co/LsYogF5rI9

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q1: 
weekly epidemiological score is derived from a combination of the absolute value & trend of intensity indicators (test positivity and total case notification rates) & severity indicators (case rates among people 65+, hospital or ICU admissions or occupancy & death rates).

Healthcare professionals should report any #SideEffects in people having #COVID19vaccines. Any new data that become available will be assessed by EMA's safety committee. #PRAC #EMAPresser

EMA will review data on the safety and immune response in people who have received a 3rd dose, or a 2nd dose in the case of the #Janssen #COVID19 vaccine. These data should be collected over the summer. #EMAPresser

EMA is in touch with vaccine developers to discuss the potential use of a booster dose and to determine the best timing and the best strategy. At this stage it is unclear whether booster doses will be necessary for the #COVID19vaccines to maintain their protection. #EMAPresser

Currently EMA can't make a recommendation on use of different #COVID19vaccines for the 2 doses. Interim results from studies in üá™üá∏ üá©üá™ & üá¨üáß show good immune response & no safety concerns. More data are awaited shortly. EMA is reviewing data as they become available. #EMAPresser

EMA has requested all vaccine developers to investigate if their vaccine provides protection against emerging new virus variants. All studies are examined by EMA to conclude on the level of protection that current #COVID19vaccines offer against new variants. #EMAPresser

Speeding up vaccination & maintaining #PublicHealth measures remain essential tools to fight #COVID19. It is important to ensure that vulnerable and elderly people complete their vaccination course ASAP to protect them from further spread of the delta variant. #EMAPresser

It seems that the 4 vaccines authorised in the EU üá™üá∫ protect against all strains, including the delta variant. First real-world data suggest that:
‚û°Ô∏è2 doses of vaccines protect against the delta variant
‚û°Ô∏èantibodies from the approved vaccines neutralise this variant. #EMAPresser

The highest level of vaccine uptake was observed among >80, reaching 80.5% for at least one dose & 66.3% for full vaccination

For healthcare workers, the median level of at least one dose uptake was 87% & for full vaccination = 65.2%

ECDC Vaccine Tracker https://t.co/Pibc05J0Yk

As of 3 June, the median cumulative vaccine uptake in the EU/EEA adult population (aged 18 years and older) had reached 46.2% for at least one vaccine dose and 22.3% for the full vaccination course. https://t.co/1TvhbNVfXl

EU/EEA countries report an increase in the number and proportion of #SARSCoV2 cases of variants of concern (#VOC) associated with increasing transmissibility and/or severity, with B.1.1.7 the current dominant variant.

Check the variants here: https://t.co/6rH1PXq7Oh
